metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23961 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Further techniques that built on the slipstream research combined with a malicious webpage could have exposed both an internal network's hosts as well as services running on the user's local machine. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23961` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Samy Kamkar, Ben Seri, and Gregory Vishnepolsky

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
